final_answer: The image uses satire to highlight a contradiction in how people view animal captivity and exploitation. On the left, there’s an elephant in chains and a person who is visibly upset about its captivity, indicating concern for animal welfare. On the right, it juxtaposes this concern with an image of people happily riding a free elephant, oblivious to the exploitation involved. The humor and satire come from pointing out this hypocrisy—expressing empathy for animals in cages while participating in activities that also exploit them.
